Package com.facetec.sdk

Class FaceTecInitialLoadingAnimationCustomization

java.lang.Object
com.facetec.sdk.FaceTecInitialLoadingAnimationCustomization
public final class FaceTecInitialLoadingAnimationCustomization extends Object
Customize the Securing Camera Screen.
Shown when securely loading and opening the camera before a Session.
Note: This is currently only shown when doing a Photo ID Scan Only Session.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    float
    animationRelativeScale
    Control the size of the animation displayed while the camera is loading.
    This value represents the scaling factor that will be applied to the default animation bounds.
    This value has to be between 0.5 and 2.0.
    int
    backgroundColors
    Color of the Securing Camera Screen's background.
    This accepts a color or drawable resource id.
    Default is white.
    int
    customAnimation
    Configure an SVG element to display on the Securing Camera Screen for the animation.
    Note: All resources required for the vector drawable animation needs to be included in your app's res directory before launching.
    Note: The animation is displayed indefinitely while the camera is being initialized, so the custom animation should be set to loop/repeat infinitely.
    int
    customAnimationImage
    Image displayed and rotated while the camera is being initialized.
    If image is configured, default animation will be hidden.
    Default is set to 0 and will fallback to using the default animation.
    int
    customAnimationImageRotationInterval
    Control the speed of the rotation for your custom animation image.
    Only applicable when image is configured for .customAnimationImage.
    This value indicates the duration of each full rotation (in milliseconds).
    Default is 1000.
    int
    defaultAnimationBackgroundColor
    Color of the default animation's background.
    Default is an off-white color.
    int
    defaultAnimationForegroundColor
    Color of the default animation's accent color.
    Default is custom color.
    int
    foregroundColor
    Color of the text displayed on the Securing Camera Screen.
    Default is custom color.
    android.graphics.Typeface
    messageFont
    Font of the message text displayed on the Securing Camera Screen.
    If this value is null, FaceTec's default Typeface will be used.

  • Field Details

    • animationRelativeScale

      public float animationRelativeScale
      Control the size of the animation displayed while the camera is loading.
      This value represents the scaling factor that will be applied to the default animation bounds.
      This value has to be between 0.5 and 2.0. If itâ€™s lower than 0.5 or higher than 2.0, it will be defaulted to 0.5 or 2.0 respectively.
      Default value is 1.

    • foregroundColor

      public int foregroundColor
      Color of the text displayed on the Securing Camera Screen.
      Default is custom color.

    • backgroundColors

      public int backgroundColors
      Color of the Securing Camera Screen's background.
      This accepts a color or drawable resource id.
      Default is white.

    • customAnimationImage

      @DrawableRes public int customAnimationImage
      Image displayed and rotated while the camera is being initialized.
      If image is configured, default animation will be hidden.
      Default is set to 0 and will fallback to using the default animation.

    • customAnimationImageRotationInterval

      public int customAnimationImageRotationInterval
      Control the speed of the rotation for your custom animation image.
      Only applicable when image is configured for .customAnimationImage.
      This value indicates the duration of each full rotation (in milliseconds).
      Default is 1000.

    • customAnimation

      public int customAnimation
      Configure an SVG element to display on the Securing Camera Screen for the animation.
      Note: All resources required for the vector drawable animation needs to be included in your app's res directory before launching.
      Note: The animation is displayed indefinitely while the camera is being initialized, so the custom animation should be set to loop/repeat infinitely. If the animation ends before the animation is dismissed, the animation will be restarted.
      If this is set to an animated vector drawable, the drawable supplied will be used instead of the default animation or any rotating-image animation configured with FaceTecInitialLoadingAnimationCustomization.customAnimationImage.
      If this is 0, FaceTecInitialLoadingAnimationCustomization.customAnimationImage will be used. If FaceTecInitialLoadingAnimationCustomization.customAnimationImage is 0, the default animation will be used.
      Default is 0.

    • defaultAnimationBackgroundColor

      public int defaultAnimationBackgroundColor
      Color of the default animation's background.
      Default is an off-white color.

    • defaultAnimationForegroundColor

      public int defaultAnimationForegroundColor
      Color of the default animation's accent color.
      Default is custom color.

    • messageFont

      public android.graphics.Typeface messageFont
      Font of the message text displayed on the Securing Camera Screen.
      If this value is null, FaceTec's default Typeface will be used. Default is null.
